name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces the process of renewing SSL/TLS certificates for the Express application in a production environment. It mentions that certificates are issued with a one-year validity period, but they can be renewed for longer durations if needed. The section outlines that the steps for generating the certificate will be discussed with the help of the IT team.
use_cases: Renewing SSL/TLS certificates for a production Express application
Generating certificates with the assistance of the IT team
Issuing certificates with a one-year validity period
Extending certificate validity beyond one year if required

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Checking Domains
description: This section explains how to check the list of domains associated with the 'express.razorpay.com' domain using an OpenSSL command. The command connects to the domain over HTTPS (port 443) and retrieves the SSL/TLS certificate. It then extracts and displays the DNS names (domains) listed in the certificate's Subject Alternative Name (SAN) field. This is useful for verifying that all the required domains are included in the certificate, which is necessary for secure communication.
use_cases: Verifying the domains included in an SSL/TLS certificate
Troubleshooting SSL/TLS certificate issues related to domain names
Auditing SSL/TLS certificate configurations for compliance or security purposes
capabilities: Certificate Subject Alternative Name (SAN) field parsing

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Generating CSR
description: This section explains the process of generating a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) for obtaining a TLS/SSL certificate from the IT team. The CSR contains information about the domains or hostnames for which the certificate will be issued. The provided code snippet shows a configuration file that specifies the details to be included in the CSR, such as the common name (CN) and subject alternative names (SANs).
use_cases: Obtaining a TLS/SSL certificate for securing web applications or services
Enabling HTTPS and secure communication for domains or hostnames
Implementing mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication for enhanced security

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Reviewing CSR
description: This section outlines the configuration for specifying the Subject Alternative Names (SANs) in a Certificate Signing Request (CSR). SANs are used to associate multiple domain names or IP addresses with a single SSL/TLS certificate. This allows a single certificate to be used for securing multiple hostnames or services, which is particularly useful in scenarios where multiple subdomains or services need to be secured under the same certificate.
use_cases: Securing multiple subdomains or services with a single SSL/TLS certificate
Enabling HTTPS for various applications or services within an organization
Simplifying certificate management by consolidating multiple certificates into one
capabilities: Secure communication for multiple hostnames or services

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Creating CORP Ticket
description: This section explains the process of generating a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) that needs to be shared with the IT team. A CSR is a data file containing information about the entity requesting a digital certificate, such as the organization name, domain name, and public key. It is a crucial step in obtaining a digital certificate from a Certificate Authority (CA) for secure communication over the internet.
use_cases: Obtaining a digital certificate for secure communication
Enabling mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication
Securing web applications and services
Establishing trust between client and server

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Verifying Certificate
description: This section explains the process of generating a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) and a private key for the domain 'express.razorpay.com'. The CSR is a file that contains information about the entity requesting a digital certificate, including the domains or subdomains to be secured. The private key is a sensitive file that should be kept confidential and is used in conjunction with the digital certificate for secure communication. The section also provides a command to review the CSR and verify that it includes all the required domains or subdomains.
use_cases: Obtaining a digital certificate for securing a domain or subdomain
Enabling secure communication (e.g., HTTPS) for a website or web application
Verifying the information included in a Certificate Signing Request
capabilities: Reviewing and verifying the contents of a CSR
Securing domains and subdomains with digital certificates

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Combining Certificates
description: This section explains how to combine multiple SSL/TLS certificates into a single certificate file. It shows the output of a command that lists the requested extensions or domains included in a combined certificate. The combined certificate includes multiple domain names like api-mtls.razorpay.com, express.razorpay.com, and others, allowing it to be used for multiple subdomains or services.
use_cases: Combining multiple SSL/TLS certificates into a single file
Using a single certificate for multiple subdomains or services
Renewing or managing SSL/TLS certificates for multiple domains
Configuring SSL/TLS certificates for load balancers or reverse proxies

name: Express | traefik-mtls cert renewal - PRODUCTION.txt - Updating Secrets
description: This section explains the process of updating SSL/TLS certificates for the Express application in the Razorpay production environment. It involves obtaining new certificates from the IT team, verifying the Subject Alternative Names (SANs) in the certificates, combining the certificates into a single PEM file, updating the secrets in the Credstash table, rotating the Traefik-MTLS pods, and checking the certificate validity. The process aims to ensure secure communication with the Express application by using up-to-date and properly configured SSL/TLS certificates.
use_cases: Renewing SSL/TLS certificates for the Express application in the production environment
Verifying the Subject Alternative Names (SANs) in the SSL/TLS certificates
Updating the SSL/TLS certificate secrets in the Credstash table
Rotating the Traefik-MTLS pods to apply the new SSL/TLS certificates
